messageBody:
Hello!
We have a slightly different approach to solve the problem:
In the Java mock framework rMock (available at http://rmock.sf.net)
there is a "standalone-feature" we call "Dynamic Suites", with which
you build your test suite programmatically. E.g. an
all-classes-in-the-project-path looks like this:

public class AllTests extends DynamicTestSuite {
public static Test suite() {
return new AllTests();
}

public AllTests() {
super("All tests");
}

protected void setupSuite() {
forEach(
is.clazz.assignableTo(TestCase.class)
.and(is.not(is.clazz.abstr()))
.and(is.not(is.clazz.name(is.containing("$"))))
)
.in(allClasses())
.perform(addAllToSuite);
}
}

This reads:
"For each item
in the allClasses() iterator
that
is assignable to TestCase
and
is not abstract
and
where the class name doesn't contain the "$" string
add the item to the suite"


Right now this approach has met our needs (run all tests in a
project), but yours seem to require a different iterator provider than
allClasses(), e.g. allClassesInThisPackageRecursively() or
allClassesInThisPackage().

If you need such an iterator or some other feature, please add a
feature request at
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=139732&atid=744309
We ususally release once a week, and user requests get highest priority.

You can read more about dynamic suites on:
http://rmock.sourceforge.net/dynamicsuites.html

Cheers
Daniel

http://www.agical.com
